title: Poor out-cast childrens song and cry, Twixt joy's and sorrows extasie. Their past and present state they view, Their old depraise, and praise their new. These father'd fatherless, their fathers bless, And beg their blessings, and this works success.
publisher: Printed by James Flesher, printer to the honorable City of London,
notes: Includes a prose comment at the end offering spinning materials, and a market for the finished yarn, to those who would employ "poor friendless harborless children".
Verse - "Shall we sigh, sing, or do neither;".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
